title: 114_hr5770
content: The Act titled "Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016" establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents of veterans. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. This plan covers veterans enrolled in the patient enrollment system and survivors or dependents eligible for medical care. The Secretary will administer the plan through contracting with a dental provider. The Department of Veterans Affairs Dental Insurance Reauthorization Act of 2016 establishes a dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents. The plan provides benefits for dental care and treatment, including diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services. Enrollment in the plan is voluntary. The Secretary will contract with a dental insurer to administer the plan. The dental insurance plan for veterans, survivors, and dependents covers diagnostic, preventative, restorative, surgical, and emergency services. Enrollment is voluntary for a minimum period set by the Secretary. Premiums will be set by the Secretary to cover all costs and adjusted annually. The Secretary shall adjust premiums annually for the dental insurance plan, and individuals must pay the full premium and copayments. Voluntary disenrollment is allowed within 30 days of enrollment. The Secretary allows voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan within 30 days of enrollment. Disenrollment is also permitted for specific circumstances to ensure fiscal integrity, such as relocation outside the plan's jurisdiction. The Secretary permits voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan within 30 days of enrollment for specific circumstances like relocation or serious medical conditions. Procedures are established for timely determinations on disenrollments. The Secretary has the authority to establish circumstances for voluntary disenrollment from the dental insurance plan. Procedures will be in place for timely determinations on disenrollments. Participation in the plan does not affect entitlement to outpatient dental services provided by the Secretary under section 1712. The plan will be administered according to regulations set by the Secretary. The individual's participation in the dental insurance plan does not impact their entitlement to outpatient dental services under section 1712. The plan will be administered according to regulations set by the Secretary and will terminate on December 31, 2021. The dental insurance plan for veterans and survivors, as well as dependents of veterans, is established. Section 510 of the Caregivers and Veterans Omnibus Health Services Act of 2010 is repealed, and the table of contents for the Act is amended accordingly.
